intro: Bugula arvensis var. tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed bugloss, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Bugula arvensis var. tridentata is often found in disturbed or marginal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
